intro: Serratula boetica var. alcalae, commonly known as the Alcalá's thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
